Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the log entries, I notice that the user is working on several documents and applications in sequence. Let me see the timeline. Starting at 08:59, they focus on Quarterly_Report.docx in Word. Then at 09:00, they focus again on Document1.docx. Then they type some content, save it, switch to Chrome for emails

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: A case should represent a coherent work session. Maybe each time the user switches to a new application or document, thats a new case? Or perhaps a case is a sequence of related activities until they switch context.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Perhaps each document being worked on is a case. For example, Case 1: Quarterly_Report.docx, Case 2: Document1.docx, the Email another, the PDF report another, and the Excel work another.

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Hmm, that might make sense. But the user comes back to Quarterly_Report later, so maybe thats part of the same case? Or each continuous session a case? This is a bit confusing.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me list out the sequence of applications and see where the cases could be divided. Looking at the timeline: 1. 08:59: Word Quarterly_Report 2. 09:00: Word Document1 3. Typing in Word Document1 4. Save 5. SWITCH to Chrome

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Each case represents a continuous flow until the user context changes significantly. Cases are defined by starting when the user begins work on a document FOCUS event and ending when they switch to a different application or close the document.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case1 Word-related until SWITCH to Chrome events 1-6. Case2 Chrome Email until SWITCH to Acrobat events7-12. Case3 Acrobat until FOCUS Excel events13-14. Case4 Excel until SWITCH to Word events15-19. Case5 Word Document1 events20-22. Case6 Word Quarterly_Report events23-26.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: For activity naming: FOCUS Start Editing Document, TYPING Typing in Document, SAVE Save Document, CLICK specific like Open Email Reply to Email Send Email, SCROLL Scroll through, HIGHLIGHT Highlight Text, SWITCH Switch Applications.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Applying to each event: Event1 Start Editing Quarterly_Report.docx, Event2 Start Editing Document1.docx, Event3 Typing in Document1.docx, Event6 Switch Applications to Google Chrome, Event7 Open Email about Annual Meeting, and so on for all events.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Case Identification: Each case represents a distinct task flow initiated by a FOCUS event on a document or application, ending when the user switches to a new context or closes the document. Activity Naming: Low-level actions mapped to higher-level activities indicating user intent.
